channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fed Holds Rates Steady as It Points to an Improving Economy
item.description: The Federal Reserve chose to pause rate cuts, even as it faces relentless attacks from President Trump for not cutting borrowing costs fast enough.

item.title: Every U.S. Olympian is going home with $200,000, whether they medal or not, thanks to a billionaire’s $100 million gift
item.description: Financier Ross Stevens’ donation hopes to give athletes more financial security.

item.title: Republicans Gave ICE a Slush Fund. Democrats Want to Limit It.
item.description: The sweeping domestic policy law that Republicans muscled through Congress last year made ICE the highest-funded federal law enforcement agency in the...

item.title: ServiceNow stock falls despite earnings beat as CEO Bill McDermott tries to get investors to stop thinking of it as a SaaS company
item.description: The workflow automation giant posted strong earnings and announced an Anthropic partnership, as it tries to convince Wall Street it deserves an AI pre...

item.title: Jerome Powell says Fed independence isn’t lost… yet. ‘I certainly hope we won’t’ lose it
item.description: Powell made clear he believes the Fed can remain independent despite attacks from the Trump administration.

item.title: Scott Bessent on the 39% of young Americans thinking favorably of socialism: They’re just not invested in the stock market
item.description: "I think that dovetails somewhat that 38% of American households have no exposure to equities," the Treasury Secretary told CNBC. Let's see in 10 year...

item.title: The American taxpayer spent nearly half a billion dollars deploying federal troops to U.S. cities in 2025, CBO finds
item.description: Trump's federal troop deployment to U.S. cities is costing about $93 million a month, according to the Congressional Budget Office.

item.title: Tesla Profit Slumps, but Investors May Not Care
item.description: The electric vehicle maker’s shares are near record highs as Wall Street focuses on the company’s plans for robots and self-driving cars.

item.title: Trump’s Political Drama With Powell Overshadows Fed Rate Decision
item.description: The Trump administration has unleashed a barrage of attacks on the Federal Reserve, including a criminal investigation into its chair, Jerome H. Powel...

item.title: Trump Threatens Iran With ‘Massive Armada’ and Presses a Set of Demands
item.description: U.S. and European officials say they have put three demands in front of the Iranians, including a permanent end to all enrichment of uranium.

item.title: South Africa Cancels Release of ‘Melania’ Documentary
item.description: The distributor, which was set to release the film on Friday, said it had canceled the theatrical premiere because of “recent developments,” but decli...

item.title: Landslide in Sicily Leaves Homes Teetering on Edge
item.description: A town in Sicily was left teetering on the edge after a landslide, triggered by a violent storm which battered southern Italy last week. More than 1,5...

item.title: Landslide Leaves Town in Sicily Perched on a Cliff’s Edge
item.description: “We are in a movie, in a horror film,” said a resident of Niscemi, where a widening chasm is threatening the town’s historic center.

item.title: Trump Threatens Iran With ‘Massive Armada’ and Presses a Set of Demands
item.description: U.S. and European officials say they have put three demands in front of the Iranians, including a permanent end to all enrichment of uranium.

item.title: Canada’s New Reality
item.description: What can we learn from Canada’s pivot away from the U.S.?
